intro: Campanula ranunculoides, commonly known as the lesser bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
